node.title: Aaron Rodgers Out After Positive Coronavirus Test
node.alt: Aaron Rodgers, a leading candidate to repeat as the N.F.L.’s Most Valuable Player, will miss a highly anticipated matchup against Kansas City on Sunday.
node.description: The Green Bay Packers quarterback will miss Sunday’s game against Kansas City after testing positive for the virus and raised questions about his vaccination status.
node.content: ["Green Bay Packers star quarterback Aaron Rodgers will miss at least Sunday\u2019s game at Kansas City after testing positive for the coronavirus.", "Jordan Love, the team\u2019s first-round pick in 2020, will start in Rodgers\u2019s place.", "The earliest that Rodgers can return, based on N.F.L. and N.F.L. Players Association protocols for unvaccinated personnel, is Nov. 13, the day before Green Bay plays the Seattle Seahawks, if he remains asymptomatic. He must sit at least 10 days and test negative twice, with 24 hours between tests.", "Rodgers, when asked on Aug. 26 whether he had been vaccinated against Covid-19, responded that he had been \u201cimmunized.\u201d NFL Network reported that he is unvaccinated.", "Rodgers added, \u201cThere\u2019s guys on the team that haven\u2019t been vaccinated. I think it\u2019s a personal decision. I\u2019m not going to judge those guys.\u201d", "Vaccinated N.F.L. players who test positive are subject to less rigorous protocols for return to team activities. They must produce negative tests 24 hours apart if they are asymptomatic. If they have symptoms, they must produce negative tests 24 hours apart and be asymptomatic for 48 hours.", "Although the N.F.L. has not mandated Covid-19 vaccines, it has strongly encouraged them by instituting stiff penalties for teams with unvaccinated personnel, including the forfeiture of games.", "For instance, unvaccinated players are required to undergo daily testing, wear masks inside the team\u2019s headquarters, and travel separately from their vaccinated teammates. They are also prohibited from engaging in a host of activities, from gathering outside team headquarters in groups of more than three players to attending house parties or bars without wearing personal protective equipment. Those who violate the protocols are subject to fines.", "Rodgers was not wearing a mask in photos that circulated on social media this week of him attending a Halloween party with several teammates. The Packers have been hit hard by positive tests over the last two weeks, having played without their top two receivers, Davante Adams and Allen Lazard, and their defensive coordinator, Joe Barry, in last week\u2019s game at Arizona. The team\u2019s third-string quarterback, Kurt Benkert, was placed on the Covid-19 list Tuesday.", "The league said in a statement Wednesday that it would review the Packers\u2019 handling of protocols. \u201cThe primary responsibility for enforcement of the Covid protocols within club facilities rests with each club,\u201d N.F.L. spokesman Brian McCarthy said. \u201cFailure to properly enforce the protocols has resulted in discipline being assessed against individual clubs in the past.\u201d", "The N.F.L. has taken breaches of Covid protocols seriously. Last season, it fined five teams \u2014 the Baltimore Ravens, Las Vegas Raiders, New England Patriots, New Orleans Saints and Tennessee Titans \u2014 for multiple violations. The league also fined coaches hundreds of thousands of dollars for not wearing face masks properly during games."]
